disease_name: Spinal and bulbar muscular atrophy/ Kennedy Disease

notes: Alleles with up to 31 copies are commonly found in the population, but there is also evidence of increased ALS risk associated with 27-33 copies.
Penetrance is highly variable, making it difficult to determine a precise pathogenic threshold.

disease_name: Frontotemporal dementia (FTD) and/or amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS)
notes: Normal and pathogenic ranges are not very well defined and vary across resources.
Interruption by other motifs like CAGA can increase stability of allele
Interruption with other motifs like CCG and CGG may be associated with later onset and milder phenotype.

disease_name: Fragile X syndrome (FXS), fragile X-associated tremor/ataxia syndrome (FXTAS), and fragile X-associated primary ovarian insufficiency (FXPOI/POF1)
notes: FXTAS and FXPOI are pathogenic at 55 copies or higher. FXS is pathogenic at 200 copies or higher.
The number of  CCG repeats may be a risk factor for CAG instability.
AR for 11 repeats, AD >12 repeats. Most known patients have (GCG)+, but GCN or any polyalanine may be pathogenic

disease_name: Cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy, and vestibular areflexia syndrome

notes: Penetrance is <100%; reduced penetrance has been reported in individuals with >80 CTG repeats.
